metadata.focus: Outpatient services - primary care, urgent care, specialist visits, labs, imaging

99202.description: Office/outpatient visit, new patient, straightforward MDM
99202.plainLanguage: First-time visit with a doctor for a simple issue. Typically 15-29 minutes of total time.

99203.description: Office/outpatient visit, new patient, low complexity MDM
99203.plainLanguage: First-time visit for a minor problem needing some workup. Typically 30-44 minutes.

99204.description: Office/outpatient visit, new patient, moderate complexity MDM
99204.plainLanguage: First-time visit for a moderately complex issue. Typically 45-59 minutes.

99205.description: Office/outpatient visit, new patient, high complexity MDM
99205.plainLanguage: First-time visit for a complex issue requiring extensive evaluation. Typically 60-74 minutes.

99211.description: Office/outpatient visit, established patient, may not require physician
99211.plainLanguage: Brief follow-up, often with a nurse - like a blood pressure check, suture removal, or injection only.

99212.description: Office/outpatient visit, established patient, straightforward MDM
99212.plainLanguage: Quick follow-up for a simple issue like medication refill or stable chronic condition. Typically 10-19 minutes.

99213.description: Office/outpatient visit, established patient, low complexity MDM
99213.plainLanguage: Standard follow-up visit for a minor problem or stable chronic condition. The most common visit code. Typically 20-29 minutes.

99214.description: Office/outpatient visit, established patient, moderate complexity MDM
99214.plainLanguage: Follow-up for a moderately complex issue or multiple chronic conditions. Typically 30-39 minutes.

99215.description: Office/outpatient visit, established patient, high complexity MDM
99215.plainLanguage: Complex follow-up requiring significant time and decision-making. Typically 40-54 minutes.

99381.plainLanguage: First well-baby checkup with a new doctor.

99382.description: Initial preventive medicine, early childhood (1-4 years)
99382.plainLanguage: First wellness visit for toddler with a new doctor.

99383.description: Initial preventive medicine, late childhood (5-11 years)
99383.plainLanguage: First wellness visit for school-age child with a new doctor.

99384.plainLanguage: First wellness visit for teenager with a new doctor.

99385.plainLanguage: First annual physical/wellness visit for young adult with a new doctor.

99386.plainLanguage: First annual physical/wellness visit for middle-aged adult with a new doctor.

99387.plainLanguage: First annual physical/wellness visit for senior with a new doctor.

99392.description: Periodic preventive medicine, early childhood (1-4 years)

99393.description: Periodic preventive medicine, late childhood (5-11 years)
99393.plainLanguage: Routine wellness visit for school-age child.

99395.plainLanguage: Routine annual physical for young adult.

99396.plainLanguage: Routine annual physical for middle-aged adult.

99397.plainLanguage: Routine annual physical for senior (Medicare Annual Wellness Visit is different).

99441.plainLanguage: Brief phone consultation with your doctor (5-10 minutes).

99442.plainLanguage: Phone consultation with your doctor (11-20 minutes).

99443.plainLanguage: Extended phone consultation with your doctor (21-30 minutes).

99281.plainLanguage: ER visit for a minor issue - quick evaluation, minimal testing.

99282.description: Emergency department visit, low complexity MDM
99282.plainLanguage: ER visit for a low-complexity problem with some evaluation needed.

99283.description: Emergency department visit, moderate complexity MDM
99283.plainLanguage: ER visit for a moderately serious issue requiring workup.

99284.description: Emergency department visit, high complexity MDM
99284.plainLanguage: ER visit for an urgent/serious problem requiring significant evaluation.

99285.description: Emergency department visit, high complexity MDM with threat to life/function
99285.plainLanguage: ER visit for a potentially life-threatening condition requiring immediate, extensive care.

36415.plainLanguage: Drawing blood from a vein, usually in your arm. This is the collection fee - separate from the tests run on the blood.
36415.notes: Usually billed once regardless of how many tubes are drawn

36416.plainLanguage: Collecting blood from a finger prick instead of a vein draw.

81000.plainLanguage: Urine test examined manually under a microscope.

81001.plainLanguage: Urine test analyzed by machine and microscope. Checks for infections, kidney problems, diabetes.

81002.plainLanguage: Basic urine dipstick test without microscope examination.

81003.plainLanguage: Machine-read urine dipstick test - quick screening for common issues.

82247.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring bilirubin - helps evaluate liver function and jaundice.

82306.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring vitamin D levels.

82465.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring total cholesterol level.

82550.plainLanguage: Blood test for muscle damage marker - often ordered for muscle pain or heart concerns.

82607.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring vitamin B12 levels.

82728.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring iron stores in your body.

82746.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring folate/folic acid levels.

82950.plainLanguage: Extended blood sugar test with multiple draws over time - used to diagnose diabetes.

83036.plainLanguage: Blood test showing average blood sugar over past 2-3 months. Key test for diabetes management.

83550.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring how well your blood can carry iron.

84132.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring potassium levels - important for heart and muscle function.

84436.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring thyroid hormone T4.

84439.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring active thyroid hormone.

84443.plainLanguage: Primary screening test for thyroid function.

84480.plainLanguage: Blood test measuring thyroid hormone T3.

85007.plainLanguage: Blood examined under microscope to evaluate cell types and shapes.

85025.description: Complete blood count (CBC) with automated differential
85025.plainLanguage: Common blood test counting red cells, white cells, and platelets, with breakdown of white cell types. Used for infections, anemia, and general health screening.

85027.plainLanguage: Blood test counting cells without the detailed white cell breakdown.

85610.plainLanguage: Blood clotting test - often used to monitor blood thinner medications like warfarin.

80048.plainLanguage: Blood panel testing 8 substances: glucose, calcium, sodium, potassium, CO2, chloride, BUN, and creatinine. Checks kidney function and basic chemistry.

80050.plainLanguage: Comprehensive blood panel combining CMP, CBC, and TSH.

80053.plainLanguage: Blood panel testing 14 substances including everything in BMP plus liver function tests (ALT, AST, bilirubin, albumin, total protein).

80061.plainLanguage: Cholesterol panel: total cholesterol, HDL (good), LDL (bad), and triglycerides.

80069.plainLanguage: Blood tests focused on kidney function.

80074.plainLanguage: Blood tests to check for hepatitis A, B, and C infections.

80076.plainLanguage: Blood tests evaluating liver function: ALT, AST, bilirubin, albumin, etc.

87081.plainLanguage: Basic culture test to check for bacterial growth.

87086.plainLanguage: Urine test to identify bacteria causing a urinary tract infection.

87491.plainLanguage: Highly accurate test for chlamydia using DNA/RNA detection.

87591.plainLanguage: Highly accurate test for gonorrhea using DNA/RNA detection.

87804.plainLanguage: Rapid test for flu - results in about 15 minutes.

87880.plainLanguage: Rapid strep throat test - results in minutes.

U0003.plainLanguage: COVID-19 PCR test processed in large batches.

87635.plainLanguage: COVID-19 PCR test - highly accurate, results typically in 1-3 days.

70030.plainLanguage: X-ray to look for metal or other foreign object in the eye.

70110.plainLanguage: Complete x-ray series of the lower jaw.

70360.plainLanguage: X-ray of neck focusing on soft tissues, not bones.

71045.plainLanguage: Single chest x-ray, usually front view only.

71046.plainLanguage: Standard chest x-ray with front and side views. Most common chest imaging.

71047.plainLanguage: Chest x-ray with three different angles.

71048.plainLanguage: Comprehensive chest x-ray series with four or more views.

73060.plainLanguage: X-ray of the upper arm bone.

73090.plainLanguage: X-ray of forearm (radius and ulna bones).

70450.plainLanguage: CT scan of the head without contrast dye.

70460.plainLanguage: CT scan of the head with injected contrast dye.

70470.description: CT head/brain without and with contrast
70470.plainLanguage: CT scan of head done twice - once plain, once with dye.

71250.plainLanguage: CT scan of chest without contrast dye.

71260.plainLanguage: CT scan of chest with injected contrast dye.

74176.description: CT abdomen and pelvis without contrast
74176.plainLanguage: CT scan of belly and pelvis without contrast dye.

74177.description: CT abdomen and pelvis with contrast
74177.plainLanguage: CT scan of belly and pelvis with injected contrast dye.

74178.description: CT abdomen and pelvis without and with contrast
74178.plainLanguage: CT scan of belly and pelvis done twice - once plain, once with dye.

70551.plainLanguage: MRI of the brain without contrast dye. Detailed soft tissue imaging.

70552.plainLanguage: MRI of the brain with injected contrast dye.

70553.description: MRI brain without and with contrast
70553.plainLanguage: MRI of brain done twice - once plain, once with dye. Most comprehensive brain MRI.

72141.plainLanguage: MRI of neck/upper spine without contrast.

72148.plainLanguage: MRI of lower back without contrast. Common for disc problems and back pain.

73221.description: MRI upper extremity joint without contrast
73221.plainLanguage: MRI of shoulder, elbow, or wrist without contrast.

73721.description: MRI lower extremity joint without contrast
73721.plainLanguage: MRI of hip, knee, or ankle without contrast. Common for joint injuries.

76536.description: Ultrasound, soft tissue of head and neck
76536.plainLanguage: Ultrasound of neck, often for thyroid evaluation.

76700.plainLanguage: Complete abdominal ultrasound including liver, gallbladder, spleen, and kidneys.

76705.plainLanguage: Focused abdominal ultrasound for specific organ.

76770.plainLanguage: Ultrasound focusing on kidneys and surrounding area.

76856.plainLanguage: Complete pelvic ultrasound for uterus, ovaries (women) or bladder/prostate (men).

76881.plainLanguage: Complete ultrasound of arm or leg, often for blood clot evaluation.

76882.plainLanguage: Focused ultrasound of arm or leg.

93000.plainLanguage: Standard heart rhythm test with tracing, interpretation, and report.

93005.plainLanguage: EKG recording without interpretation (interpretation billed separately).

93010.plainLanguage: Doctor's reading of EKG tracing (tracing done elsewhere).

93306.plainLanguage: Complete heart ultrasound showing heart structure and function. Includes Doppler.

93307.plainLanguage: Heart ultrasound showing structure without blood flow measurement.

10060.description: Incision and drainage of abscess, simple
10060.plainLanguage: Draining a simple skin abscess or boil.

10061.description: Incision and drainage of abscess, complicated
10061.plainLanguage: Draining a more complex abscess requiring additional work.

10120.plainLanguage: Removing a splinter or other foreign object from skin - simple case.

10121.plainLanguage: Removing foreign object requiring incision or more complex extraction.

11102.plainLanguage: Shave biopsy - removing a thin layer of skin for testing.

11104.plainLanguage: Punch biopsy - removing a small circular piece of skin for testing.

11200.description: Removal of skin tags, up to 15

11300.description: Shaving of lesion, trunk/arms/legs, 0.5cm or less
11300.plainLanguage: Shaving off a small skin growth.

12001.plainLanguage: Stitching a simple wound up to 1 inch.

12002.plainLanguage: Stitching a simple wound 1-3 inches long.

17000.description: Destruction of premalignant lesion, first lesion
17000.plainLanguage: Freezing or burning off a pre-cancerous skin spot (like actinic keratosis).

17003.description: Destruction of premalignant lesions, 2-14 lesions, each

17110.description: Destruction of warts, up to 14 lesions

20610.plainLanguage: Injection into or drainage of a large joint (knee, shoulder, hip).

20605.plainLanguage: Injection into a medium-sized joint (wrist, ankle, elbow).

20600.plainLanguage: Injection into a small joint (finger, toe).

69210.description: Removal of earwax, one or both ears

90471.plainLanguage: Fee for giving the first vaccine injection (drug cost separate).

90472.plainLanguage: Fee for each additional vaccine injection.

96372.plainLanguage: Giving an injection of medication (separate from the drug cost).

96374.plainLanguage: Administering medication by IV push (quick injection into IV).

90791.plainLanguage: Initial mental health evaluation - comprehensive assessment with a psychiatrist or psychologist.

90792.description: Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation with medical services
90792.plainLanguage: Initial psychiatric evaluation that includes medical assessment (can prescribe medications).

97110.plainLanguage: Physical therapy exercises to improve strength, flexibility, or range of motion. Billed per 15-minute unit.

97112.plainLanguage: Training to improve balance, coordination, and movement patterns.

97140.plainLanguage: Hands-on physical therapy techniques like massage, mobilization, or manipulation.

97530.plainLanguage: Functional activities to improve real-world abilities.

97535.plainLanguage: Training for daily living activities and home exercises.

97542.plainLanguage: Training to use a wheelchair safely and effectively.

97760.plainLanguage: Training to use a brace or orthotic device.

97010.plainLanguage: Application of heat or ice as part of therapy.

97014.plainLanguage: Electrical muscle stimulation (e-stim) therapy without constant supervision.

97032.plainLanguage: Electrical stimulation therapy with direct supervision.

97035.plainLanguage: Therapeutic ultrasound (deep heat) for muscles and soft tissue.

97161.plainLanguage: Initial physical therapy evaluation for a straightforward condition.

97162.plainLanguage: Initial physical therapy evaluation for a moderately complex condition.

97163.plainLanguage: Initial physical therapy evaluation for a complex condition.

97164.plainLanguage: Follow-up evaluation to assess progress and update treatment plan.
